doc.title: Awaiting Full Contribution from Optical Semiconductors

passages.text: August 28, 2025 06:30 AM GMT
Dexerials (4980) | Japan
We fine tune our forecasts for F3/26-28, but leave our PT unchanged and stay EW as we think it will be some time before optical semiconductors start fully contributing.

**Reiterating** **¥2,200 PT, EW rating: We revise our forecasts for F3/26-28 in light of** F3/26 1Q results. We adjust our FX assumption for F3/26 3Q onwards from ¥140/$ to ¥145/$. Our profit forecasts for F3/26-28 are largely unchanged. In F3/26, we forecast BP to fall, but if excluding the impact from yen appreciation, we expect profit to remain high thanks to the earnings contribution from high added-value products featuring the firm's differentiated technology, such as particle-arrayed ACF.Earnings grew rapidly these past few years, but momentum is now lacking. Our F3/27 EPS estimate is unchanged, so we keep our PT at ¥2,200 (based on segmental P/Es; gives a F3/27e P/E of 15.5x). Dexerials' share price has underperformed TOPIX ~26ppt YTD, making it one of the worst performers (second worst) in our chemicals coverage. We put this down to it being a best performer in 2024, profit being forecast to fall in F3/26, and sales stagnating due to slow yield improvement in highly anticipated optical semiconductors. Shares do not look cheap or expensive at a P/E of ~14x vs F3/27e EPS, so we stay EW. We think the profit contribution from optical semiconductors will need to grow for the price to rise in earnest.

**Fine tuning F3/26-28 profit forecasts: F3/26 1Q BP beat our forecast by ¥900mn,**with Optical Materials & Components (OMC) greatly outperforming (strong sales of anti-reflection (AR) film for laptops, driven by greater-than-expected replacement demand), but Electronic Materials & Components (EMC) underperforming (shortfall in optical semiconductor sales and higher fixed costs). For the full-F3/26, we revise our BP forecast from ¥32bn to ¥32.5bn after lowering our forecast for EMC and raising our forecast for OMC to reflect 1Q results. Our BP forecast is for a 15% YoY fall as, while we expect sales volumes to increase for AR film for laptops and precision bonding results we assume yen appreciation (~¥4bn impact) and higher upfront costs (~¥4bn) will cause a 2-digit decline. Dexerials assumes an FX rate of ¥135/$ (BP guidance: ¥29bn), so we think guidance could be hiked at the time of 1H results. For F3/27, we assume FX rates will stay flat, and forecast BP to +5% to ¥34bn (unchanged) on growth in sales of automotive AR film and profit gains in optical semiconductors. In F3/28, we forecast BP +6% to ¥36bn (unchanged), driven by growth in sales of differentiated products. We estimate sales of optical semiconductors to Datacom (such as optical transceiver products for data centers) topped ¥1bn in F3/25, and we forecast this to grow to ~¥2bn in F3/26 and ~¥3.5bn in F3/27, but we expect the profit contribution to be negligible.
MORGAN STANLEY MUFG SECURITIES CO., LTD.+
**Dexerials (4980, T, 4980 JT)**

Watch how fast optical semiconductors business contributes to earnings
Key: Historical Stock Performance Current Stock Price Price Target
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research

Growth in product group based in differentiated technologies, such as particle- aligned ACF and antireflective films for notebooks PCs and other applications. We think assessment of the global project for automotive optical elasticity resins needs to wait until a certain level of results becomes available. We evaluate positively the firm's strategic investments, such as the acquisition of the optical semiconductor devices business, from a long- term perspective. Trading at a P/E of \(\sim 14x\) our F3/27e, the stock looks neither under- nor overvalued; hence our EW rating
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research
F3/27e EPS ¥168.3 x around 18
Smartphone & LCD markets strong (ACF & optical resins & AR films shipments grow steadily)
F3/27e EPS ¥142.3 x around 15.5
Smartphone & LCD markets stay about flat (weak optical resins sales, but ACF & AR films shipments maintain slight growth)
F3/27e BPS ¥683.2 x around 2.2
Smartphone & LCD markets weak (ACF & optical resin & AR films shipments weaken)

- Margin gains fueled by a shift in high-end optical elasticity resin products (from SVRs to hybrid SVRs).- In ACF, sales for use in camera modules and applications other than displays are expanding.- Increased use of AR film in automotive electronics.

- Major FX swings (each ¥1 depreciation vs. USD boosts Business Profit by ¥500mn); we assume ¥145/US\$ from 3Q F3/26 onwards. The company assumes ¥135/US\$ for F3/26. Positive trend in the smartphone and LCD markets.
- Market share declines in sputtering type AR films due to tougher competition with peers- Reduced use of optical elastic resins due to structural changes in touch panels.

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub-regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
